content.en: Codebook optimization: Researchers have proposed various algorithms to optimize the design of codebooks in sparse code multiple access (SCMA) systems. These algorithms improve the quality of initial information, convergence reliability, and maximize mutual information in SCMA. They also minimize the upper bound of pair-wise error probability (PEP), achieve near-optimal designs for SCMA codebooks, and improve the convergence reliability of detected layers. Additionally, algorithms have been developed to combine the advantages of probabilistic shaping and geometric shaping in SCMA codebook optimization. These advancements aim to enhance the performance and efficiency of SCMA systems in different channel environments.
content.da: Kodebogoptimering: Forskere har foreslået forskellige algoritmer til at optimere designet af kodebøger i sparsom kode multiple access (SCMA) systemer. Disse algoritmer forbedrer kvaliteten af indledende information, konvergenspålidelighed og maksimerer gensidig information i SCMA. De minimerer også den øvre grænse for parvis fejlsandsynlighed (PEP), opnår næsten optimale designs for SCMA kodebøger og forbedrer konvergenspålideligheden af detekterede lag. Derudover er algoritmer blevet udviklet til at kombinere fordelene ved probabilistisk formning og geometrisk formning i SCMA kodebogoptimering. Disse fremskridt sigter mod at forbedre ydeevnen og effektiviteten af SCMA systemer i forskellige kanalmiljøer.
